name: src/controller.mjs
Controller
description:
When using a controller that is of the traversal type, or the static type
a zone is REQUIRED. Only two controllers of traversal or static or one of each can be used at a time. 
These controllers have to have opposing zones. Left | Right
Traversal: spawns at the touch position and when dragged, follows the finger across the screen
Static: spawns at the touch position, cannot move from that location, just updates the joystick and will clamp at its limit
Stationary: cannot move from it's position at all, will just update the joystick and clamp it at its limit, can be pressed from anywhere on screen.

name: MAX_LAYER
description: The maximum layer

name: tween
description:
A reference to the tween instance this controller uses to tween the alpha when it becomes inactive.
This reference is so that developers can pause this tween and resume it when needed.
Calling this.tween.pause() and this.tween.resume() for instance when pausing and unpausing the game.

name: joyring
description: The joyring element of this controller.

name: joystick
description: The joystick element of this controller.

name: version
description: The version of the module.

name: options
description: The options of this controller.

properties.name: options
properties.description: The options of this controller.

properties.name: options.type
properties.description: The way this controller will behave. stationary | traversal | static.

properties.name: options.size
properties.description: The width/height of the joystick. The width & height of the joystick should be the same.

properties.name: options.position
properties.description: The initial position of the joystick.

properties.name: options.position.x
properties.description: The initial x position of the joystick.

properties.name: options.position.y
properties.description: The initial y position of the joystick.

properties.name: options.lockedDimension
properties.description: The locked dimension of the joystick. both | vertical | horizontal. This is used to lock the joystick from moving in certain dimensions. If this joystick's type is traversal it cannot be locked.

properties.name: options.zone
properties.description: The zone the joystick will occupy. If there is already a controller of the traversal or static type, then you must use a zone. If there is only one controller no zone is needed. left | right This will give each controller equal space on the left | right sides of the screen.

properties.name: options.inactiveAlpha
properties.description: The alpha value the joystick will be when it is considered to be inactive.

properties.name: options.transitionTime
properties.description: How long it takes in ms to transition to the inactiveAlpha value.

properties.name: options.scale
properties.description: The scale you want the joystick controller to be.

properties.name: options.plane
properties.description: The plane of the joystick controller.

properties.name: options.layer
properties.description: The layer of the joystick controller.

properties.name: options.atlasName
properties.description: The atlasName of the joystick.

properties.name: options.joystickIconName
properties.description: The iconName of the joystick.

properties.name: options.joyringIconName
properties.description: The iconName of the joyring.

properties.name: options.callback
properties.description: An object holding options callbacks to attach to events the joystick emits.

properties.name: options.callback.onTouchBegin
properties.description: Callback to be called when the joystick is touched after being released.

properties.name: options.callback.onRelease
properties.description: Callback to be called when the joystick is released and no longer held.

properties.name: options.callback.onMove
properties.description: Callback to be called when the joystick is moved.

description: The locked dimension of the joystick. both | vertical | horizontal. This is used to lock the joystick from moving in certain dimensions. If this joystick's type is traversal it cannot be locked.

name: zone
description: The zone the joystick will occupy. If there is already a controller of the traversal or static type, then you must use a zone. If there is only one controller no zone is needed. left | right This will give each controller equal space on the left | right sides of the screen.

name: activeInZone
description: Whether this controller is active in zone. e.g the controller is zoned to the left, and the user taps on the left side of the screen.

name: controllingFinger
description: The fingerID that is controlling the joystick.

name: active
description: Whether this controller is active

name: onRelease
description: Event function for when the joystick is released.

name: onMove
description: Event function for when the joystick is moved.

name: handleTransition
description: Tweens the controller to it's inactive alpha preset, or from it's inactive value preset to full alpha.

params.name: pFade
params.description: Whether to fade the joystick to it's inactive alpha preset

name: reset
description: Resets the joystick to default.

params.name: pSoft
params.description: Softly resets the joystick in the event it is hidden

description: Returns the type of this controller.

description: Updates the controllers position with the latest information from touch events

params.name: pX
params.description: The x position on the screen where the user tapped.

params.name: pY
params.description: The y position on the screen where the user tapped.

params.name: pTouchStart
params.description: If this was the first time the joystick was touched.

name: release
description: API called when this joystick is released

params.name: pForce
params.description: If this was a forced release. Called progamatically.

name: lock
description: Locks a joystick from moving in a certain dimension or both

params.name: pDimension
params.description: The dimension to lock. both | vertical | horizontal

name: unlock
description: Unlocks the joystick from being locked in the passed dimension.

params.name: pDimension
params.description: The dimension to unlock. both | vertical | horizontal

name: getComponents
description: Returns the components that make up this controller. Which are the joystick element, and the joyring element.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - An object containing references to the joytick and the joyring that makeup this controller.

return.description: An object containing references to the joytick and the joyring that makeup this controller.

name: hide
description: Hides this controller

name: show
description: Shows this controller

name: src/mobile-handler.mjs

unknown.tagValue: The MobileHandler module provides a user-friendly interface for game developers to integrate touch-based controls for their game characters on mobile devices. It offers features for creating a visual joystick on the screen and facilitates mobile device interaction, including accessing device information and triggering device vibrations.

MobileHandler is free software, available under the terms of a MIT style License.
When lowpower mode is on it makes game run slower, from 60fps to 30fps

name: MULTI_TOUCH
description: Whether or not an instance can be touched by multiple fingers. If their touchOpacity is set to MULTI_TOUCH it can be interacted with multiple times via different touches.

name: NO_TOUCH
description: Whether or not an instance can be touched or not. If their touchOpacity is set to NO_TOUCH, it cannot be touched

name: MAX_RECYCLED_CONTROLLERS
description: The max number of controllers that can be recycled

name: MAX_LAYER
description: The maximum layer

name: recycledControllers
description: An array of all controllers that have been recycled

name: activeControllers
description: An array of all controllers that are active

name: zonedControllers
description: An object holding the controllers in zones

name: touchedInstances
description: An array that holds all the diobs that are currently being touched

name: mapPositionObject
description: An object that stores the mapPosition over the screen

name: reservedScreenZones
description: An array that holds the current screen zones taken, 'left' or 'right'.

name: windowSize
description: An object holding the current window size

name: xCenterScreenPosition
description: The middle of the screen's x coordinate. This is used to figure out which side of the screen is being interacted with.

name: instanceWeakMap
description: Weakmap to track data belonging to instances used in this module.

name: version
description: The version of the module.

name: logger
description: The logger module this module uses to log errors / logs

name: interfaceHandle
description: The mobile handler interface that our controllers will exist in

name: getSafeAreaInsets
description:
An object containing the safe area offset values to account for the notch on notch enabled devices. This will keep the UI in a safe area
The safe-area-inset-* variables are four environment variables that define a rectangle by its top, right, bottom, and left insets from the edge of the viewport, 
which is safe to put content into without risking it being cut off by the shape of a nonrectangular display. 
For rectangular viewports, like your average laptop monitor, their value is equal to zero. 
For non-rectangular displays  like a round watch face  the four values set by the user agent form a rectangle such that all content inside the rectangle is visible.
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/env

properties.name: top
properties.description: safeAreaInsetTop.

properties.name: right
properties.description: safeAreaInsetRight.

properties.name: bottom
properties.description: safeAreaInsetBottom.

properties.name: left
properties.description: safeAreaInsetLeft.

name: getSafeAreaTop
description: Short hand for getting the safe area inset for the top of the screen.

name: getSafeAreaBottom
description: Short hand for getting the safe area inset for the bottom of the screen.

name: getSafeAreaLeft
description: Short hand for getting the safe area inset for the left of the screen.

name: getSafeAreaRight
description: Short hand for getting the safe area inset for the right of the screen.

name: detectDeviceType
description: Detects the type of device based on user agent.

name: vibrate
description:
Vibrates the mobile device.
https://github.com/apache/cordova-plugin-vibration#readme
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Vibration_API

params.name: pDuration
params.description: The duration of the vibration.

return.description: Whether this device is an android device.

description: Gets the device's current RAM. Only works in a cordova environment.

description: Queries the safe area inset values set by the device and stores them.

name: safeAreaValues
description:
An object containing the safe area offset values to account for the notch on notch enabled devices. This will keep the UI in a safe area
The safe-area-inset-* variables are four environment variables that define a rectangle by its top, right, bottom, and left insets from the edge of the viewport, 
which is safe to put content into without risking it being cut off by the shape of a nonrectangular display. 
For rectangular viewports, like your average laptop monitor, their value is equal to zero. 
For non-rectangular displays  like a round watch face  the four values set by the user agent form a rectangle such that all content inside the rectangle is visible.
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/env

properties.name: right

properties.name: bottom

properties.name: left
properties.description: safeAreaInsetLeft.

description: Check if the user agent string contains 'Android'

description: Check if the 'ontouchstart' event is supported

name: isMobile
description: Whether this device is mobile or not. Can be simulated.

name: track
description: Starts internally tracking this instance.

params.description: The instance that needs to be tracked.

description: Checks if the instance that was touched is being tracked internally.

params.name: pTouchedInstance
params.description: The instance that needs to be tracked.

description: Returns the tracker object associated with pTouchedInstance if it exists.

unknown.tagValue: {Object|void} The tracker object associated with pTouchedInstance if it exists. void if not.

params.name: pTouchedInstance
params.description: The instance that needs to be tracked.

return.description: The tracker object associated with pTouchedInstance if it exists. void if not.

name: handleZoneTouch
description: Handles when a finger is placed onto the screen in a zone

params.name: pX
params.description: The x position on the screen where the user tapped.

params.name: pY
params.description: The y position on the screen where the user tapped.

params.name: pFingerID
params.description: The ID of the finger

name: handleZoneRelease
description: When a finger on the screen is removed it checks to see if it belongs to a zoned controller. If so it releases that controller.

params.name: pFingerID
params.description: The ID of the finger.

name: handleZoneMove
description: When a finger on the screen moves, check if the fingerID belongs to a zoned controller, if it does update that zoned controller

params.name: pX
params.description: The x position on the screen where the user tapped.

params.name: pY
params.description: The y position on the screen where the user tapped.

params.name: pFingerID
params.description: The ID of the finger

name: handleStart
description: The event function called when a touch starts.

params.name: pEvent
params.description: Represents an event which takes place in the DOM.

name: handleEnd
description: The event function called when a touch ends.

params.name: pEvent
params.description: Represents an event which takes place in the DOM.

name: handleCancel
description: The event function called when a touch is canceled.

params.name: pEvent
params.description: Represents an event which takes place in the DOM.

name: handleMove
description: The event function called when a touch is moved.

params.name: pEvent
params.description: Represents an event which takes place in the DOM.

content:
# MobileHandler Module

The MobileHandler module provides a user-friendly interface for game developers to integrate touch-based controls for their game characters on mobile devices. It offers features for creating a visual joystick on the screen and facilitates mobile device interaction, including accessing device information and triggering device vibrations.

## Installation

### ES Module

```js
import { MobileHandler } from './mobile-handler.mjs';
```

### IIFE (Immediately Invoked Function Expression)

```js
<script src="mobile-handler.js"></script>;
// ...
window.MobileHandlerBundle.MobileHandler;
```

### CommonJS (CJS) Module

```js
const { MobileHandler } = require('./mobile-handler.cjs.js');
```

### Global Dependency

MobileHandler relies on the `VYLO` variable being globally accessible.

  "description": "The MobileHandler module provides a user-friendly interface for game developers to integrate touch-based controls for their game characters on mobile devices. It offers features for creating a visual joystick on the screen and facilitates mobile device interaction, including accessing device information and triggering device vibrations.",
  "main": "src/mobile-handler.mjs",
  "scripts": {
    "test": "echo \"Error: no test specified\" && exit 1",
    "build:rollup": "npx rollup -c",
    "build:docs": "esdoc -c esdoc.json",
    "build:dist": "npm run build:rollup && npm run build:docs"
  },
  "keywords": [],
  "author": "https://github.com/doubleactii",
  "license": "SEE LICENSE IN LICENSE.md",
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "https://github.com/EvitcaStudio/MobileHandler"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@rollup/plugin-babel": "^6.0.4",
    "@rollup/plugin-terser": "^0.4.4",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "rollup": "^4.14.1",
    "rollup-plugin-banner2": "^1.2.3",
    "rollup-plugin-cleandir": "^2.0.0",
    "rollup-plugin-replace": "^2.2.0"
  }
}
